intro: Antirrhinum minor, commonly known as the common snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, two-lipped flowers that bloom in shades of red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has opposite, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Antirrhinum minor is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
